SENT.plain: We report a case of putaminal haemorrhage from a venous cerebral angioma following thrombosis in a draining vein
The patient complained of numbness of the right side, followed by headache and aphasia
CT demonstrated an intracerebral haemorrhage due to thrombotic occlusion of a draining vein of the venous angioma
Carotid angiography showed the venous angioma
MRI studies confirmed the diagnosis and demonstrated recanalisation of the draining vein following therapy with phenprocoumon
